greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of forests on n unlabeled nodes with all nodes of degree <= k (n>=1, 0 <= k <= n-1).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
R. Neville, Graphs whose vertices are forests with bounded degree, Graph Theory Notes of New York, LIV (2008), 12-21.
formula: Column k is Euler transform of column k of A144528. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 18 2020
example: Formatted as an array to show the full columns:
program: (PARI) \\ Here V(n,k) gives column k of A144528.
MSet(p,k)={my(n=serprec(p,x)-1); if(min(k,n)<1, 1 + O(x*x^n), polcoef(exp( sum(i=1, min(k,n), (y^i + O(y*y^k))*subst(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), x, x^i)/i ))/(1-y + O(y*y^k)), k, y))}
V(n,k)={my(g=1+O(x)); for(n=2, n, g=x*MSet(g, k-1)); Vec(1 + x*MSet(g, k) + (subst(g, x, x^2) - g^2)/2)}
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 20 2008
ext: Terms a(29) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 18 2020
